items.title: Document title
items.help_text: Document title

items.title: Unique ID number for the document
Unique ID number for the document
Date of Production
items.help_text: Document production date using format(YYYY-MM-DD)

items.title: Document version
items.help_text: Identify and describe the current version of the document

items.title: Unique user defined ID
items.help_text:
The ID number of a dataset is a unique number that is used to identify a particular survey. Define and use a consistent scheme to use. Such an ID could be constructed as follows: country-producer-survey-year-version where 
 - country is the 3-letter ISO country abbreviation 
 - producer is the abbreviation of the producing agency 
 - survey is the survey abbreviation 
 - year is the reference year (or the year the survey started) 
 - version is the number dataset version number (see Version Description below)

items.title: Other Identifiers
items.help_text: Identifiers such as ISSN, ISBN, DOI

type.title: ID Type
type.help_text: Identifiers such as ISSN, ISBN, DOI

items.title: Institutional review board
items.help_text: Information on whether and when the project was submitted, reviewed, and approved by an institutional review board (or independent ethics committee, ethical review board (ERB), research ethics board, or equivalent).

items.title: Output
items.help_text: Description of outputs of the research project

type.title: Type
type.help_text: Type of outputs of the script/research project. Example: `Working paper`, `On-line interactive data visualization` (ideally, a controlled vocabulary should be used)

items.title: Approval process
items.help_text: Description of project output review process

items.title: Project website link
items.help_text: Project website link

items.title: Language
items.help_text: Documentation language e.g. English, French, etc.

items.title: Date of production (YYYY-MM-DD)
items.help_text: Date when the project (dissemination-ready version) was implemented

items.title: Version Responsibility Statement
items.help_text: The organization or person responsible for the version of the work

items.title: Errata
items.help_text: List of corrected errors in data, scripts or output

items.title: Process
items.help_text: A description, following a logical sequence, of the various phases of the research project implementation. This field may be used to document explorations steps that may have resulted in dead ends, to document intermediary steps at which a project may have been reviewed and approved, etc.

items.title: Authoring entity
items.help_text: The person, corporate body, or agency responsible for the work's substantive and intellectual content. Repeat the element for each author, and use 'affiliation' attribute if available. Invert first and last name and use commas.

name.title: Agency Name
name.help_text: Name of the person, corporate body, or agency responsible for the work's substantive and intellectual content. If a person, invert first and last name and use commas.

role.title: Role
role.help_text: Title of the person (if any) responsible for the work's substantive and intellectual content.

items.title: Contributor(s)
items.help_text: The person, corporate body, or agency who contributed to the project.

name.title: Agency Name
name.help_text: Name of the person, corporate body, or agency responsible for the work's substantive and intellectual content. If a person, invert first and last name and use commas.

role.title: Role
role.help_text: Title of the person (if any) responsible for the work's substantive and intellectual content.

items.title: Sponsor
items.help_text: The source(s) of funds for production of the work. If different funding agencies sponsored different stages of the production process, use the 'role' attribute to distinguish them.

name.title: Agency Name
name.help_text: Name of the person, corporate body, or agency responsible for the work's substantive and intellectual content. If a person, invert first and last name and use commas.

role.title: Role
role.help_text: Title of the person (if any) responsible for the work's substantive and intellectual content.

parent_id.title: Parent topic Identifier
parent_id.help_text: For subtopics, provide the ID of the parent topic

items.title: Source code repository
items.help_text: Source code repository

name.title: Repository name
name.help_text: Name of the repository where code is hosted. e.g. `Github`, `Bitbucket`, etc.

items.title: Technology environment
items.help_text: Notes about specific technology environment for the project

items.title: Technology requirements
items.help_text: Any specific software.hardware or other requirements

items.title: Methods or algorithms applied
items.help_text: Methods or algorithms used

items.title: Software
items.help_text: Software

items.title: Scripts
items.help_text: Description of each script file

instructions.title: Instructions or note for running the script

items.title: Data statement
items.help_text: Overall statement on data used by the project.

items.title: Datasets
items.help_text: List and description of datasets used by the research project
